I played the beta of this game by myself and just now tried to play the game with a friend (just one friend).  
This is a multiplayer, 4 vs 1 game, and you cannot play with friends unless you can FORM AN ENTIRE PARTY OF JUST YOUR FRIENDS.  So including you, five people.  If you only want to play with a few friends there is no system to do so - the developers have promised to release this feature shortly after release.

How on EARTH do you release a multiplayer game and not have this KEY FEATURE in it?  The beta players had been requesting it and Starbreeze didn't include it on the day of release?  This is moronic, and I refuse to support an incompetent design choice.

In addition, this game appears to be poorly optimized, as it runs poorly on my machine and isn't graphically impressive enough to warrant such poor performance.

I cannot recommend; playing with random people is ok, but it can't beat the experience of playing with a few friends.  Shame on Starbreeze.

FIRST OFF, IF YOU ARE EVEN A SLIGHT FAN OF SURVIVAL HORROR, YOU OWE IT TO YOURSELF TO PLAY THIS GAME!!! 

 I just have to say that i have been wanting a game like this for a long time. Think, hide and go seek, only the hiders have an objective that they must carry out to escape (turn on five generators and then make it to a gate) and the Seeker is a cold blooded murderer seeking to sacrifice their souls to the "Entity." BTW, I would reccomend reading through the online game manuel for the "Lore" which, while not neccessary for the enjoyment of the game itself, also makes the game more interesting by filling in details about the maps, the killers, and the survivors. It's as good or better than some creepy pasta's I have read in the recent past. This game gets my pulse pounding and my adrenenaline racing. Easily the best twenty bucks i have ever spent on steam, as well as one of the best multiplayer survival horror games I have ever played. 

Having said that, I will say that some will complain that the game is not as polished as it could be, and while that may be true to an extent, my enjoyment has been diminshed not at all.

Furthermore, for those that are saying that the lobby is broken, it is true that I have been left waiting due to people dropping out, but i just left that lobby and hit join lobby again and was playing in a matter of a minute or two. The longest i have had to wait was to be the killer, but that makes sense since so many people want to be the killer, and every killer creates a new lobby there might not be enough survivors to go around at that moment.

-Эй, Джонни, сегодня релиз нашей игры!
-Блин, я и забыл... Тааак, где у нас бета постарее... Оп! Нашёл, всё, сейчас залью.
-Но Джонни, в той версии нет русского языка, мы же им обещали!
-Забей Фрэнк, подождут.
-И анимация там не проработана, модельки сквозь карту летают...
-Так, хватит Фрэнк, скормим им в течение месяца пару мелких патчей, вернее версии более поздней беты.
-Но у нас же всё готово, неужели нельзя дать нормальную версию?
-Ага, а отдыхать когда? Неет уж, делаем как я придумал.
-А бонусы за предзаказ?
-Да хватит им 3х ключей к прошедшей бете (кстати, удали её из стима), пары масок к пд2 и скидки в 20%.
-Но Джонни, они будут называть нас бракоделами и сраными мракобесами! Я не хочу...
-Хватит ныть Фрэнк! В первый раз что ли? И вообще, закажи лучше пиццу...

В общем игра сырая как подвалы Питера, но играть можно, хоть и со слезами на глазах.

Let me start off this review with stating that I love the game, this game is absolutely bananas! It's so much fun and the gameplay gets your adrenaline pumping... but most of the fun it could be offering Is being taken away from us (more on that later).

[h1] The Gameplay [/h1]
As the killer, as you're stalking your prey and looking out for the survivors knowing they're not able to defend themselves is like childs play. After finally spotting your prey and chasing them, as the survivor helplessly tries to get away from you makes you feel like a REAL psychopath. After catching your prey, you can either grab your prey over your shoulder and take the survivor to your dungeon and hang him up on a meathook or leave him suffering there on the ground and use him as bait. Taunt and scare your prey if you're playing as the hillybilly by revving up your chainsaw to help your prey get rid of constipation. Spook your enemies to the death whilst playing as the wraith by uncloaking yourself and gong your bell.
Lay traps near objectives as the trapper, so you can wait in the bushes for them to step on them and then either waiting for others to help the helpless pray you've just caught or just hang him on a meathook, it's your choice. After either killing all of your prey or letting some of them escape, you're rewarded with points to upgrade your "power" and investing points into your skilltree gives you the feeling of accomplishment.

As a survivor, you're trying to work on the objectives at the same time as you're trying to keep one eye open for the killer. Getting spotted by the killer and being chased through the scary and atmospheric environments is just nothing but scary! Helping your friends out of trouble whilst risking your own life at the same time makes you feel like a hero and scavenging for anything to help you survive is breathtaking. Whilst completed the required objectives to get the go-ahead and open up the gates to escape the horrors and running out of the playground of the killer feels rewarding! Investing points you've gained throughout your adventures of either misfortune or success to your skilltree makes you feel accomplished.

[h1] The Problems [/h1]
Too bad you can't get the satisfaction this game offers to you of the last points that I mentioned, from neither, from the killer's perspective or the survivor's, because you can only play this game with friends in a "private game" which doesn't offer you any "experience" points or the chance to progress your characters which is the only reason I dislike this game.

The developers must include a party option to this game, so you can make a lobby for your friends to queue up for a ranked game AS SURVIVORS, not one being the killer and the rest as survivors, that'd be cheating. If the devs consider queing up with your friends IN THE SAME TEAM "cheating", they've got to be joking. The only logical reason this wasn't implemented to the game must've been because they could inform their friends where the killer is via 3-party program. There are no any other ways to communicate with other survivors in the game, they need to add a proximity voice chat, so ANYONE can hear your voice if they're in your proximity, the killer included. Great alternative for this would a voiceline wheel, with restrictions, e.g not being able to use voiceline wheel when stuck in a meathook. Having the killer also hear these voicelines, if he's close enough to the survivors making this option very fair.

[h1] The Conclusion [/h1]
The only reason keeping me from recommending this game for you & your friends, is the reason stated above. If they decide to update the game and allow us to queue up with friends as survivors into a same game where you could make progress with your character, then I would recommend this game for you. Missing on an important game mechanic of improving your character, being taken away from and punishing you for playing the game with your friends is absurd and VERY BAD game design. I only recommend this game to you if you're planning on playing alone with randoms. To get the most out of the game IF played with friends, is to wait for the devs to release the party queue.

</rant>

Comment 6/15/2016
It will be a good game if the developer can finish it, at least fix the known bugs. But currently I have to give this game a not recommend comment. May change it when those bugs got fixed.
Bug 1. 3 men hang on the hook, but game never ends.
Bug 2. Carry a survivor on the ground, but got stuck and can't move.
Bug 3. Wraith can attack ppl when stealthing
Bug 4. Killer lose rank whenever a survivor D/C
Bug 5. Survivor lose rank whenever killer D/C
Bug 6. OBS can't capture the game by game capture and window capture. Game frame drop to 30fps when using screen capture.

I reported most of the bugs in beta server, but none of them got fix.
Play with friends!! Good game.

5 players - 4 survivors and 1 maniac, who hunting them.
If he kills everyone, he won. Survivor can win by escaping the map.

It's my humble opinion:
The game have really unusual gameplay, first time it will be pretty scary, but once you understand all of the basics - your fear will go away and you will feel nothing but adrenaline.
Cons:
- Originality
- Dynamics (never seen before such a high pace of gameplay in horror games)
- This game got atmosphere. It's really oppressive
Pros:
- Need more content (number of perks, items in a skill tree is OK, but the rest need some more variety, like maps. There is only 3 of them).
Also I didn't understand the difference between survivors. Maniacs have 3 types and all of them have different skills.
But survivors? Appearance? Well, it's definitely not enough!

I give 8/10 for now.

Used to recommend the game. Quite original and was very scary as survivor and empowering as killer when you first start. 

Here's the thing: there are so many bugs, it's not worth listing them in a review (although other reviewers have.) Just know that there are many game-breaking bugs, which have persisted throughout multiple patches with new ones being introduced. 

Developers seem nice, and I don't want to be that jerk who just comes down on them. However, they have a real tendency to say "stuff is coming soon to fix that; yadda yadda, let's talk about this new DLC." 

Heard of Starbreeze and the bullshit they pulled with Payday 2? Yeah, you bet your ass similar exploitative tactics are happening here. Made the mistake of buying one of the DLCs because I liked the killer concept. Turns out she sucks (hag) to the point of being nearly totally unviable. 

It's a shame. Fun game; felt that I've gotten what I spent on it out of it. However, you should know that you're in for bugfest and DLCfest 2017 if you decide to buy it; frankly, I'd recommend against purchasing now to disincentivize this kind of developer/publisher behavior; also for the bug BS that I had expected to be patched out soon after the game FIRST published, lol! Fat chance of that, or of many newer mechanics being introduced (hexes are just about irrelevant.)

Very well done game for a small dev company. Without a queueing system for ranked games with friends, I feel like this game is going to lose its fire pretty quickly. Playing as a Survivor gives you the willies and a few of us were in voice coms together and were screaming like little babies! When you're a killer, it's pretty effing satisfying to hook and sacrifice people! The chase really gets your blood pumping, too lol.

I'm upvoting this game because I hope other people will give it a try so the devs can add the much needed features to take this to the next level.

TLDR: Fun as hell as survivor and killer, needs ability to queue with friends and earn bloodpoints but with some checks and balances so boosting doesn't happen. Overall: worth it.

Ok so... This game is recieving a TON of hate ***(my spelling sucks FYI)*** And the reason is because players who don't read news just say you cannot queue with your friends on ranked and can only do private requiring 5 friends. Well there are some things these reviewers are not puting out there. There WILL BE an option to queue with your friends in a plubic match WITHIN THE NEXT WEEK. Another thing worth mentioning is I only have 1 other friend to play with in this game... I spent 5 hours of gameplay with him in 5 player matches... All you have to do is add randoms in game or post somthing letting people know you wanna add to play with your friend and if they want to play with there friends with more than 2 or 3 people to add them... It took him like 10 minutes to do all of that... I know this review is so clustered and no1 is going to read it but GG... Oh and also the gameplay is great and knowing that they are going to add a friend/invite queueing system makes me know its just stupid to not recommend a game thats going to include this feature within the week.
I like this game and it really accelerates my heartrate.

Great game, progression systems adds a nice replay mechanic. Rumor has it you can prestige. Games loses the spooky factor after 5 or 6 hours , but doesnt lose the anxiety factor. They ARE making the party system, which might be OP for killer but who knows, in KYF they reduce difficulty based on survivor amount, so it's not impossible for them to raise difficulty since you can communicate. But for my friends and I, we are lobby hopping and weve played about 10 or 12 games together. Its fun solo or with friends. Definietly more scary/anxious without mates. Great game, hope to see customization come to fruition. Wonderful purchase for 15 (or 20) bucks.
Fun game

Fun concept, but it has too many problems:
 - Bugs and balance issues -- game was released too early
 - Low framerate on a high end gaming system
 - Can't tweak video settings other than Low, Medium, High and Ultra
 - Can't even change resolution!
 - Can't rebind keys
 - Idiotic point system ruins an otherwise fun game
 - Can't change mouse sensitivity
 - Survivors lose rank if killer leaves. Bug was in the beta and wasn't fixed for release.
 - Takes too long to get into a game as people keep lobby hopping trying to queue up with their buddies.
 - If only killer and one downed survivor is left and there are no hooks nearby, the killer has to camp the survivor until the survivor bleeds to death -- something like 3-5 mins. So much fun both for the killer and for the survivor!

Für mich ist das Spiel eindeutig eine Kaufempfehlung.

Ich hatte selten so viel Spaß bei einem Spiel und der Puls ist ständig auf 180.

Die Spielmechanik ist meines Erachtens wunderbar aufeinander abgestimmt. Diese ganzen Minigames in denen man unter Zeitdruck und dem Killer im Nacken irgendwelche (Maus)-Tasten drücken muss.

Ok, seit dem Release spielt die Lobby irgendwie verrückt, aber ich hoffe doch, dass dieses Problem in Kürze behoben wird.

Das man nicht als Gruppe einem Spiel joinen kann, ist eventuell als Makel anzusehen. Aber wer mit Freunden spielen will hat ja trotzdem die Möglichkeit, muss aber halt 4 Freunde haben die das Spiel haben ;)

Ich denke auch das es ein erheblicher Nachteil für den Killer wäre, wenn er auf ein eingespieltes Überlebenden-Team trifft. Ich glaube da würde einiges an Spannung verloren gehen. Meines Erachtens auch für die Überlebenden selbst!

Abschliessend möchte ich nochmals bemerken das es sich um ein Koop-Spiel handelt. Also ihr lieben Überlebenden, repariert Generatoren, befreit Eure Mitstreiter und heilt diese. Wer will schon am Haken sterben...

Came back recently, same out of touch devs and still the worst community I've ever encountered,

watched my teammate get struck and picked up. While holding my teammate the killer spots me across the cornfield, decided this is my time, this is my chance, decide to be a hero. I charge the killer with my flash light, ready to blind him and save my teammate. then i run into bear trap, looking like a bloody fool. the killer strikes me, downs me, gives me a back and forth gesture like "no", realized he was telling me i suck. Teammate helps me up, generators are all up, exit made clear. Nows my chance, I can see the open gate, heart beating and monster chasing me, then i get caught in bear trap, look like a bloody fool, the killer strikes me, downs me, gives me a back and forth gesture like "no"

10/10 would gladly look like a fool again.

Игра хорошая. Атмосфера ужаса просто божественная, то чувство когда ты сидишь за укрытием и видишь маньяка оно просто необъяснимое. Игра на 4 игрока которые могут помогать тебе или же спасаться сами. Игра интересная Жду новых Карт!!!

This game has the potential to be amazing. At launch, however, that potential is unrealized. The matchmaking and lobby system are an absolute disaster. I have a bit over 2 hours in this game, and in that time I have spent about and hour and 15 minutes looking for matches and about 45 minutes actually playing the game. In over 2 hours of time I have managed just 2 games. That is absurd any way you look at it.

The problem boils down to this: 

-Games are hosted client-side by the Killer, who opens a lobby and waits for four Surviors to fill it.  The server ends as soon as the game ends. You then have to go through the MMing all over again to find a new game. 

-Playing the Killer is way more appealing than playing the Survivors, and you need FOUR times as many Survivors as you do Killers in matchmaking for equalilbrium. The numbers are obviously no where near that, thus resulting in extremely long queue times. tl:dr too many people want to play Killer.

-There is no party system in place, so you have to time when you enter the queue and hope you end up with friends. This results in a Killers lobby being filled with 4 Survivors (after a several minutes wait), only to have 2 of them immediately back out when they realize they aren't with their friends. The remaining 2 survivors stick around for a bit, but when nobody else shows up after a few minutes they invetibly leave as well, leaving the Killer to start the process all over.

I think the game needs to move to a dedicated server system, where players stick around after matches and the Killer rotates. I know I would be a lot more willing to queue as a Survivor if I knew eventually I would be able to play as a Killer without having to go through MMing again.

As it stands, if you want to play as a Killer, good freaking luck.

This game is very challenging and fun. Highly recommend for non-casual players looking for a thrill and a good time.

平时不怎么写评测，这次要给这游戏点个大大的赞。
先来说说这游戏的优点：
1.这款游戏最重要的是乐趣，这让我们会想起求生之路，游戏内容让我们回归了游戏最初目的就是给我们带来原始的刺激和乐趣，你可以和基友开黑，玩起来真是乐趣穷。
2.作为幸存者，你时时刻刻感到紧张，尤其是恶魔逼近时，让你充分感到身为猎物的恐惧感。反之恶魔，你则会享受着狩猎者的快感，尤其是鞭笞着你的猎物时你甚至会狂叫来发泄自己的情感。
3.作为一部跑酷求生游戏，不论是狩猎者和猎物，游戏考验着你的跑酷技巧，尤其是应变能力和条件反射能力，这点很符合游戏主题，不搞乱炖，60几块的价值与游戏的性价比是很匹配的，可以说是很优秀的游戏。
再来说游戏的缺点：
1.首先是平衡性问题，本人认为恶魔追猎难度是高于求生者难度（全杀），碰到老手的话实际上是很难抓的，求生者逃脱和求生的方式技能有很多。反观恶魔，甚至受困于地形而一个人也抓不了。当然恶魔真正难度在于全杀。
2.作为一个刚出的还不错的游戏，过多吐槽其缺点是对游戏开发团队的不尊重，我们希望在陆续的更新中会弥补一些问题，当然最后最重要的是：官方中文！

Para ser nuevo el juego y no haber aun algún tipo de actualización, es bastante decente, seguramente solucionen el problema de cuatro jugadores en el futuro.

El problema de (hoy y seguramente en los próximos días) que en ocasiones no haya servidores, se debe simplemente a que el juego también es demasiando nuevo y aun no hay bastantes jugadores para encontrar con quien jugar las 24h (sin tomar en cuenta que es un juego de paga y sin más jugadores no se puede jugar).

En cuanto a Bugs, no hay alguno destacable a lo que llevo jugando a simpe vista. 

Con confianza lo recomiendo bastante!

Mi conclusión:

Aunque no tengas con quien jugar, te lo pasaras genial con otros jugadores, por su atmosfera y música de constante suspenso.

Overall, great fun!

Final review:
At the time of this writing, the developer has released three paid DLCs but has failed to fix the problems which have persisted since beta, including: survivors exploiting "infinites" and killers "camping" their captured prey.

At its core, Dead by Daylight is a very fun, addictive game. If you stay at the low ranks it's fun for killers and scary fun for survivors. But as you rise in the ranks you meet more and more people who know and use exploits and un-fun tactics to win at any cost. Making matters worse, a large portion of the community is irredeemably toxic and hateful. Take a browse of the official forum.

Dead by Daylight might be great someday, but until then please save your money. Friday the 13th: The Game is coming early 2017...

Fun game but really needs a way to play with friends that is not private game. Being able to play with friends you invite as well as random players would make this game 10x better.

I was worried about this game when I saw it was being published by Starbreeze, aka the people who completely ruined Payday 2, but after having played it for a little bit, it's actually quite an enjoyable game.  The mechanics feel very fleshed out and, to me at least, playing as a helpless survivor was fun, too.  I'll just get to the "TL;DR Buy" recommendation now because the biggest issue with this game is a lack of players.

I was curious how well the "start generator, exit level" mechanic would work.  The catch with the generators is that at random intervals you will need to time a button press or else the generator will make a loud noise and alert the hunter to your position.  So while you're basically just sitting there listening for the hunter indicator to go off, you're also paranoid about when the prompt will pop up and be able to react to it.  I'm not too big a fan of the quick time events, but they work well enough.

I was also worried that it would be a bad balance between hunter and the hunted, but I think it works fairly well.  Checking closets for victims takes a good 5 or so seconds, so if you're chasing someone and you stop to check a closet, they may end up losing you (which is easy to do) or if you decide to follow the way you think they went, they can slip out of the closet you decided not to check ... or from behind some rocks you didn't even notice.  As a "victim", with the maps being randomized to a extent (of course, it's so dark that you couldn't really tell anyway) it's all about thinking on your feet.  Even though you can't fight

There's still a couple of things that need to be worked on for this to be a solid recommendation.  One thing would be steamworks integration so I can invite people to a public match.  Another would DEFINITELY be a re-evaluation of the item system - you apparently lose items you unlock through the skill tree if you die (which, as a victim, is likely), and without a more outlined way to get them back again, it just seems like a waste of skill points and, ultimately, a waste of a skill system.  The biggest problem the game has right now is a lack of playerbase, and waiting for a full server can be a serious waiting game (and disappointment when you FINALLY have a full match and then someone leaves)

Overall, though, there is a lot to like here.  The mechanics are simple enough, though some of the more specific nuances of the mechanics (like the above mentioned generator QTE or how your skill-tree items can be simply gone because you died) are not explained.  Still, for $20 ($17.99 right now), it's a pretty good game.  There's already room for expansions, like more characters and hunters, different clothing options and so on which I think could be cool - but again, being a Starbreeze published game, I'm scared they may push it down the same path to DLC Hell.  However, as long as they can control themselves, I think the devs have made something really nice here - and proof that multiplayer CAN actually be a scary experience.

TL;DR Buy the game so we can have more players

This is now my sixth, and final, revision of my Dead by Daylight review.

As a day one player, screw you Behaviour.

I bought your cosmetics. I warily bought a few "battle passes", only for the cosmetics to end up in the store anyway. I played through every iteration of BS. But NFTs? Yet you can't fix your game or add new game modes.

I'm not coming back. And neither should any of you. I hope Propnight and other asymmetrical horror games run this piece of dog crap into the ground.
